subject: Re: [junit] Looking for some "Best Practices"
msgSnippet: ... I ve seen cases where this constructor is used to add only certain methods to a suite, for example: suite.addTest(new MyTest( testSomething ));
messageBody:
Erik Hanson wrote:

>> public @Class( String name )
>> {
>> super(name);
>> }
>>
>>
>
>This constructor is no longer required for JUnit. I haven't found any
>disadvantage to not using this constructor; does anyone know of one?
>
>

I've seen cases where this constructor is used to add only certain
methods to a suite, for example:

suite.addTest(new MyTest("testSomething"));
suite.addTest(new MyTest("testSomethingElse"));

It's particularly common in suites that attempt to define a test order.

That said, the need to do so is usually an indication of a more general
problem.

Mike
